title.narrative: Emergency Nutrition response for internally displaced persons and vulnerable host communities affected by drought and conflict.

description.narrative:
Due to drought and conflict, the nutrition situation in Badghis province has deteriorated. In mid-June 2018, World Vision International Afghanistan conducted a multi-sectoral assessment whose results of the nutrition situation relevant indicators are as follow: MUAC measurement results show a Global Acute Malnutrition (GAM) rate of 32.8% (24.8- 42.0 95% C.I.) Moderate Acute Malnutrition (MAM) rate of 16.9% (10.7 - 22.8 95% C.I.) and Severe Acute Malnutrition (SAM) of 15.9% (10.9 - 25.4 95% C.I.). SAM and MAM is extremely higher among girls than among boys (42.3% among girls compared to 25% among boys). The prevalence of edema is 10.9%. Children 6 to 41 months have the highest level of SAM and MAM as compared to other age categories. The results show that 150 out of 342 women had a MUAC measurement of less than 23 cm, which means that 43.8% of pregnant and lactating women are malnourished.
In Herat, WV has been providing mobile Nutrition and Health services to 9,000 IDPs households and screening data shows the prevalence of GAM is 25% (9% SAM and 16% MAM). The needs among these new IDPs are high and these are compounded by the inability of these IDPs to access services from Health facilities in Herat.
In response, WV proposes to provide lifesaving integrated nutrition services to drought and conflict-affected IDP in Herat and vulnerable host communities in Badghis. The proposed intervention will primarily target under -5 children and PLWs among the IDPs and drought-affected population in 4 districts of ( Abkmary, Jawand, Muqur, Bala Murghab) of Badghis and two districts of Herat Province (Injil and Zenda Jan). As per consultation with regional Nutrition Cluster and in alignment with the Nutrition cluster priority districts. World Vision proposes provision of 9 Integrated mobile Nutrition teams ( 4 for five districts in Badghis and 5 for new IPDs in Injil and Zenda Jan districts of Herat province) for acutely malnourished children and PLWs. In addition provision of preventative services ( IYCF in emergency) for children, under-5 and PLWs across the affected districts will be done through partnership with community health workers, Family Health Action Group members and health shuras. Using these approaches World Vision will be able to reach out to more people in need by improving the capacity of health care providers, community health workers, family health action groups and health shuras to implement the quality live saving IMAM, and IYCF in emergencies. There is a total of 7 districts which will be targeted by World Vision in Herat and Badghis provinces, the total estimated SAM cases which will be covered during the course of 9-month project life will be 4,975 children under-5 with SAM, 7,772 children under-5 with MAM as well as 2,908 PLWs with MAM.
World Vision has put a higher target for SAM and MAM coverage, 75% in the rural areas which the recommended target is 50%, therefore for the 9 months target, the project will stick to the same figure for six months.
